channel.title: Okay...Wtf?
channel.description:
Alright guys. I have gone over about 13 different guides. Everything is working, Compiler, Run server, editing the server etc. I even port forwarded, edited the variables needed.
The problem, No one can connect....
I asked my friend, she used the webclient, put in my IP, and then my hostname XXXXXX.hopto.org (Not going to say my name haha)
Can someone please help me out.
I am really sick of people calling us noobies when we can't get simple, or even more than simple help from ya'll.
Please help a brother out. Cheers :)

item.title: Okay...Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @LeetBix LeetBix
item.description:
@LeetBix wrote:

Yeh, i really want this to work. But i dunno how… and this “helpful” community is doing it’s best lol.

But really, thanks to the people who attemped to help. And i’m going to bed. If ANYONE know’s a way to fix this please fill me in, I’m using a Netgear DG834G Router.

Any help would be a godsend. Night guys.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 12, 2009, 11:55:05 pm[/size][hr]Kay guys i’m back.

I did everything again, Opened 43594, Did what i was told to do with port forwarding, putting 192.168.0.1 as the Internal/Outgoing parts.

I used PFPortChecker, still blocked?

I seriously need some help sigh

Read full topic

item.title: Okay...Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Rii0N Rii0N
item.description:
@Rii0N wrote:

I got the same problem. I know my ports are right cos people could connect to my 317 servers etc but not on my 508 & 525. Might be something in the server files thats wrong not your port or IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay...Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @LeetBix LeetBix
item.description:
@LeetBix wrote:

Ok i tried re-doing the whole portforwarding thing, not much luck though. I use my 192.168.0.1 etc in all the LAN fields. Do i have to do anything else? My No-IP is automatically set to my ADSL2 IP ADDRESS, not my LAN IP ADDRESS. So… any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Okay...Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

you use your ipv4 ip. open command prompt and type in ipconfig find the one that looks like this: 192.168.0.1 you will have a number from 1 - 5 put that ip into the box.

Read full topic
